channel.title: CSS Background repeat
channel.description:
I have this line of code in my css code under body:
background: #FFFFFF url(header_background.gif) top left repeat-x;
Which repeats this image across the top of the page:
[img]http://www.ownaclub.com/duck/header_background.gif[/img]
I need another one of these to do the same across the bottom of the page (footer_background.gif) how can I do this?
****UPDATE****
My only thought of a way to work around this so far is have a big background so it covers the header and footer as above... Only problem is the footer is lower down on some pages as there is more content and I have to move the footers around manually using CSS because I dont know a better way... I could use Iframes and put all the content in them to make each page the same size but I dont really want to, any ideas?

item.title: CSS Background repeat
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

For most browsers, you can only have one background image per container. Therefore you can set the one on top to be the background of the body. Then you’ll need to make a div that takes up the entire body, and to do that, I would just do something like this (except the style is in an external stylesheet instead of inline):

<body style="background:url(images/.....gif) repeat-x top-left;">
  <div style="width:100%; height:100%; background:url(images/.....gif) repeat-x top-left;">
    <!--CONTENT GOES HUR-->
  </div>
</body>

Try that and see how it ends up. Show me the site, and I’ll see if I can make it automatically expand to whatever content is inside so you don’t have to manually set it.
